designations.source: A review of the beetles of Great Britain: The Darkling Beetles and their allies
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the threat status of Darkling beetles  from work originally undertaken in 1987, 1992 and 1994 using the IUCN methodology for assessing threat. Aderidae, Anthicidae, Colydiidae, Melandryidae, Meloidae, Mordellidae, Mycetophagidae, Mycteridae, Oedemeridae, Pyrochroidae, Pythidae, Ripiphoridae, Salpingidae, Scraptiidae, Tenebrionidae & Tetratomidae (Tenebrionoidea less Ciidae).  K.N.A. Alexander, S. Dodd & J.S. Denton.  http://naturalresources.wales/media/2487/species-status-review-of-the-non-marine-mollusca-of-great-britain.pdf http://naturalresources.wales/media/2487/species-status-review-of-the-non-marine-mollusca-of-great-britain.pdf http://naturalresources.wales/media/2487/species-status-review-of-the-non-marine-mollusca-of-great-britain.pdf http://naturalresources.wales/media/2487/species-status-review-of-the-non-marine-mollusca-of-great-britain.pdf. May 2014.
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which are neither threatened nor near threatened.
designations.comments: Under-recorded. Likely to be in excess of 100 hectads.
